Reviews.Title: “The satisfaction of bookiing by Branson Tourism”
Reviews.Author: Edna C
Reviews.Content: This hotel was suggested to us by Bransom Tourism. The clerks at the desk were very friendly and courteous. The room was very clean on our arrival and was kept that way the entire time that we were there. The bed was very comfortable, and it was quiet so we had very restful nights. I would definitely stay there again, and I would not hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful and cordial”
Reviews.Author: Chiquis1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed at thie hotel while visitng Branson, it was recomended to us by a share property company. The front desk staff we dealt with were wonderful with the exception of one getlemen, he must of had a bad day but at the end he was very nice. We stayed in building 1 which has been remodeled after the earthquake, and they were nice and clean. Missing a few amenities and the room service was ok. They forgot to leave coffee sometimes or to place a trash in the bathroom, but overall it was a nice place to stay and relax. One thing we did not like was the outdoor pool, it was at the other building with no shade, and not the most convenient way to get there. We had to go through our building and then walked through the parking lot in our suits, crossed the grass area and then enter building 2, take the elevator and finally found it. The pool itself was very nice and clean, just again not very convenient. Our building had the indoor pool, unfortunatelly the day we tried for some reason the heat was on and as it was outside, there was no way to enjoy it. Breakfast time was great, they alternate it every other day, so always the same, we would have liked to have some fruit, yougurt, available, but the lady that runs it is so amazing that you do not miss that once you talk to her. Loved the idea of having homemade oatmeal, and the pancake machine was an exit. Again, we enjoyed the area so we ended up adding an extra night to our stay and hated to leave. Kuddos to the front desk for making us feel so welcome and providing very clear directions to located places to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyTrahan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the Grand Oaks for Labor Day weekend and it was great! Great staff, great room ( we had the Pinnacle suite), and very clean. The breakfast was good and the area was always clean. Melissa at the front desk was so helpful and friendly. Just a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not elaborate”
Reviews.Author: linkay6
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at the Grand Oaks. I had read previous reviews so wasn't sure what to expect - some were great and some not so much. I was pleased with the hotel. We just had a regular king room, which was newsly remodeled and very nice and up-to-date. The bathroom was a little small, had to move to the other side of the toilet to open/close the door. The shampoo/body wash dispenser was nice - I like the idea. The towels were big and fluffy and there was plenty of hot water in the shower. The bed was comfortable and there were four nice pillows supplied. Our room was on the first floor, and the ice machine was on the second floor. Not that big of a deal, but FYI. There are two hot tubs, but the jets were out of order on one. The other one was just the right temperature. We were in Building 2 and the hot tubs and indoor pool are in Building 1. They didn't tell us we had to pick up towels from the reception area, we learned that the second night, fortunately we had brought our own. We didn't get in either pool, but they looked clean. I had read a lot about the breakfasts being so great. The first morning we had breakfast we were disappointed. There was no protein available and everything was carbs (biscuits and gravy - altho the biscuits were VERY good, pancakes, cereal, etc). Not healthy for a pre-diabetic. The next morning there was sausage and eggs and they were both delicious, along with pancakes and cereal. That's when we found out they alternate the "protein" between the two buildings - not sure why they do it that way? We didn't find the hilly parking lot an issue, as I had read in another review. The parking lot is hilly but if you are able to park close to the building, you don't notice it so much. The staff was very friendly and helpful when we asked for their recommendation of a place to eat. The WiFi was reasonably fast. The hotel is conveniently located to restaurants and activities, including Silver Dollar City, although it was in a quieter area off the main route. Silver Dollar City has added a lot of things since I was there last. Many more activities and rides for smaller children. All the demonstrations are still fun to watch, even though I've been there many times. Overall we enjoyed our stay and were pleased with the hotel selection.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: toribis
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and had a great time. The staff was very friendly when we checked in and it only took a few minutes to get checked in. We stayed in the newly remodeled building, it was very clean and the location was great. I have to say the lady serving breakfast was very friendly, we enjoyed talking to her during our stay. She always had a smile on her face and the breakfast area very clean and the food was fresh.We would recommend staying here and we will stay here when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Great LOCATION!!”
Reviews.Author: tacolley
Reviews.Content: We loved the location, cleanliness, the continental breakfast, friendly staff, the pool & spa were nice & clean. Enjoyed the fridge in the room for waters & sodas. A quiet place to rest & sleep. Reasonably priced

Reviews.Title: “great rooms”
Reviews.Author: beach080109
Reviews.Content: Great rooms in building 2 all new,check in was great the lady was helpful.our reservation was exactly what we were told.this was the our second time to stay here. we will stay here again.this motel is just off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Remodeled”
Reviews.Author: MaryannBuffalo_NY
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights as part of a package including showes. Great location, just off the strip, on the yellow bypass route. Easy to get to everything. We stayed in the newly remodeled building two. The room was spacious and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. Building 2 has an outdoor pool that was open until 11 pm- great after a hot day! There is also an indoor pool; in Bldg. 1 but we did not use it. The included breakfast was ok. There was always cereal, oatmeal, pancakes, some fresh fruit and bread for toast. There were 2 hot choices that alternated days. WE would definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!!”
Reviews.Author: P B
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed at a hotel or cheap motel, that did not clean your room, this was a first for us.. We went with 2 adults & 2 kids age 9 & 5. The room was so small, you barely had room to walk between the bed & the TV. There was no place to plug in our cell phones. The curtains wouldn't shut all the way. There were only 3 towels for 4 people. We asked for more towels & they gave us 5. That 1 thing was the only good thing about the place, because the next day they didn't clean our room & only had 2 towels to give us. We had the do not disturb sign on our door until 11:30am, then left for the day & changed the sign to service please. When we returned at 7:30pm, our room had not been cleaned. We had a show to go to, so I didn't have time to go the front desk. I called & was told the cleaning people had gone for the day & they put on their notes we had DND sign. When told we left at 11:30 & changed the sign, they said "Oh, they should have went back & checked your room before they left for the day." They did not know how that happen. They told us when we got back to stop at the front desk & they would give us some towels & trash bags if we needed them. We did not get back until 11:30pm & they only had 2 towels to give us. No apologies, no offer of anything to make up for not cleaning our room. The parking is horrible also. They do not have enough parking in the front of the building, there is parking in the back, but your room key won't open the back doors. You have to walk up the hill to the side doors. We pulled around front to turn around & there were workers out front smoking. The girl said wait a minute & I will move my car so you can park. So the employees park up front in the limited parking spaces. This is the first review I have ever done. This was the worst place I have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Very affordable & clean!”
Reviews.Author: BeckyCla
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a quick school shopping trip. We stayed in the newly renovated building # 2 it was very clean and up to date with new paint and linens. Check in was easy and you can't beat the location....right off the strip. The pool was open till 11pm so after a long hot day of shopping and fun we enjoyed cooling off in the pool. I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: 86dragracer
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, new bathroom fixtures. Very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Keep Looking....”
Reviews.Author: JaxsMom
Reviews.Content: The hotel photos are very deceiving on the iternet! The hotel is very old, the front desk staff is very rude and the "hot breakfast" is basically a contiental breakfast! I booked the hotel on booking.com and was under the impression I could use the fitness equipment without an extra charge - WRONG. I was charged $3.99 a day to use the fitness equipment. The whole staff was rude with the exception of the housekeeping and 1 very nice lady at the front desk. I know the housekeeping staff are nice because our room was beside the laundry room and their door was open all the time so every time I walked out of our room I was greeted by them. The kitchen cook was very loud annoying. Breakfast was terrible. In our room there was used toilet paper on the holder and leftover food and beer in the refrigerator. There was yellow staines on the comforter. The inside pool was not heated... it was VERY cold! It was so cold we could not swim. We wont be staying here anymore!!

Reviews.Title: “Great review”
Reviews.Author: Dianna J
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the cleanliness and friendliness of this hotel. We are retired and travel frequently. We had taken our daughter and grandsons with us and reserved two rooms in the new "2nd" tower. It wasn't finished yet so we were given upgrades without any request. Baseboards were even clean!! Thank you Grand Oaks! We will return....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Clean Room- Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Texanbornandraised
Reviews.Content: The Grand Oaks is centrally located in Branson. You can pick up all the alternative routes so you do not have to get on 76 (the main street) except for the portion of 76 where you need to be for shows, etc. The room we had was in the oldest building as the new one was not complete yet. It was close to the indoor pool. The smell of chlorine was strong at different times of the day in the hallway. The room was small, having 1 queen Bed and a pull out couch. Refrigerator, Microwave & coffeepot was in the room. Our microwave never worked. We reported this the night we arrived & after 6 days it was never fixed or replaced. They were nice enough to let us use the one in the breakfast area. Breakfast was either eggs (instant) and sausage links or bisquits & gravy (also instant). Cold cereals, oatmeal, bagels, toast (the toaster had problems). The coffee was great. The room was clean and fresh towels put out daily. We got this room through a package deal. It worked for what we needed. It was always quiet, even when people were coming back from some of the late activities that go on. The beds are new and we slept great. There is a Walmart around the corner so if you need anything it is close. There are 2 mini golf courses down the street. The Titanic musuem is fairly close as well. Will stay with Grand Oaks again when we go back but will ask for the new building as I believe they told me the rooms will be bigger.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, lovely, quiet property”
Reviews.Author: BernardJ771
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for six nights in June 2012 with a travel group. I am a very fussy guy when it comes to hotel rooms and I will go out of my way for privacy and quiet. This hotel has both, and more. Inside hallways for a budget hotel is somewhat unusual, but this hotel has them so no people are walking by your window so you can keep your drapes open. The property is on a side street instead of a main boulevard so no noisy trucks are constant,y driving by. It is conviently located near most theatres and restaurants, and is clean and well cared for by an active management. Do yourself a favor and stay here so you can get a restfull nights sleep and enjoy the pleasure of the town.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds, nice and clean with freindly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Longhairedgnome
Reviews.Content: We and another couple stayed at the Grand Oaks for five nights last week. From previous reviews and information/photos on the hotels website we were all looking forward to our stay. We had also picked this hotel from a few options provided with a package deal purchased through the tourism board. First off let me say that the hotel was nice and clean and the beds were very comfy. I even liked the pillows and I NEVER like hotel pillows! The staff was friendly and helpful. The only thing that was disappointing was the breakfast. They alternated between biscuits and gravy and scrambled eggs. I didn't try the biscuits so can't say if they were any good or not, but the eggs were just okay. The pancake machine is at the end of the counter and was creating a problem with so many people waiting to get pancakes that no one could get to the rest of the hot food. And they weren't worth the wait. There were two toasters and neither of them worked very well. Overall we had a good stay at the Grand Oaks and I would recommend it to others. The location was fantastic being just off the strip. It made getting around to shows and area attractions very easy. We also enjoyed the pool and hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Best home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Dorothy M
Reviews.Content: Courteous and very accomodating. Always clean. Good breakfast bar. Were called away on previous visit due to family medical issue and were immediately credited for remainder of reservation time. ( no 24 hr. notification mentioned) Have stayed there since and will stay there only. Recommend to EVERYONE !!

Reviews.Title: “Branson here we come”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn J
Reviews.Content: This nice hotel is very close to main street. Good rates and nice rooms. Enjoyed the warm pool, while waiting out a snow storm. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was very good. We would certainly book this hotel again on another trip.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Oaks Hotel is the best”
Reviews.Author: Patsteele438
Reviews.Content: Grand Oaks Hotel rooms are so nice and their employees are the best when you walk in to check in they welcome you and they will tell you if their is anything that can do for you please let them know this is our fourth time that we have stay their and this hotel makes you feel like their family so if anyone ask where is a best hotel to stay at I would say the Grand Oaks Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Everything about our stay was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Sally M
Reviews.Content: From the initial phone call to make the reservation, through 2 changes of dates on our part, the staff was terrific! The room was neat, clean, very comfortable, the breakfast was great, the desk staff helpful, efficient and just plain fun- especially Cathy. And Bill and Brian did their best to keep us sorted out! All good folks!They are in the midst of a major remodel, and had to deal with not only lots of guests, but the arrival of gutters, carpeting,furniture etc and yet it was all handled beautifully and never interfered with the day-to-day running of a hotel! This will be our home-away-from-home whenever we go to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Just Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Ricky D
Reviews.Content: The people thjat was on duty this last week-end was wonderful. they were there to help every time we needed something. The full breakfast was so nice we did not have to go out for breakfast each morning. We had gravy and biscults, hot oat meal,cold cereal, pancakes, toast, bagal, fruit, apple and orange juices,and coffee. the coffee was made 24hrs a day.The rooms were very nice and even those we were right next to the desk and starway it was very quite.We have thanked Branson Tour Center for booking us for the 4 day herre at Grand Oaks.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and great service.”
Reviews.Author: Lucindam68
Reviews.Content: This hotel for the money is very decent. The rooms are being remodeled and the floors are clean. They have added a refridgerated and microwave in each room which is a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Kim72150
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews I was a little worried with this motel. I went with my gut and decided to stay there. This was our first trip to Branson and we were celebrating our first anniversary. I'm so glad we decided to stay there. The rooms were very clean, beds were AWESOME and we had te best nights sleep. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our first night te air went out in our room and they moved us to another room with no problems. We had a jacuzzi in our room and it was great relaxing time! We will be coming back and I know for sure where we will be saying.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Paula L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a trip to Branson, Mo. We spent 10 days there in the Grand Oaks Hotel. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly, helpful and courteous. The breakfast bar was good with lots of choices. We really enjoyed our vacation, We would stay there again. Paula

Reviews.Title: “Grand Oaks Hotel, Branson, Enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: Jan A
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and nice. The personnel were helpful and friendly. The breakfast bar was good with lots of choices. I would stay there again. Jan Adams

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: kathyhiley
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was very good with lots of variety. Rooms very clean.

Reviews.Title: “NOT TEEN FRIENDLY”
Reviews.Author: Ifeelliketravelingon
Reviews.Content: We took a group of teens to Young Christians Weekend at Silver Dollar City. We were joined by other youth groups who were friends and family of ours. We were excited to be able to fellowship with them and relax and just rest from our long days at the park. Well the hotel staff in particular Alyssa treated us like we were more of a pain than a paying guest. We literally spent thousands to stay here for the entire weekend and we were treated extremely rude. If I were to tell it all this would take an entire 3 page paper. Just wanted to let other youth groups know that Grand Oaks is NOT teen friendly at all.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break in Branson”
Reviews.Author: happycamper654871
Reviews.Content: Grandsons had a great time in the in-door pool. Hot breakfast was great. Hotel was clean and help was friendly. The only suggestion would be to add a small refrigerator to each room. They are so handy when traveling with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: Becky E
Reviews.Content: I have never been to a hotel where my daughter (7) and I were treated like family. My daughter loves Bill and all she wanted to do at first was help him work, talk to him, or assist him with anything she could. As a parents view he and all the staff at night were great. Nobody there has ever been rude, we have stayed at the Grand Oaks several times it gets better every stay. on our last visit my 7 year old had saw on a disney show where at some spa some fluffed there pillows so my child called the front desk and he came and fluffed her pillow.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Clean. Good price.”
Reviews.Author: amy257_11
Reviews.Content: We live in the Branson area, and decided to do a local one night away. We stayed at the Grand Oaks in Branson. It was excellent. Super clean. Incredible service from the front desk and morning breakfast server. And the price was more reasonable than other places. The room is beautifully decorated. Pool was great. Definitely recommend. Located right off the 76 strip, near Panera.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Snazzynana
Reviews.Content: We spent New Year's here. Great service... Breakfast server was great. She seemed rushed at first impression but was very helpful when we took the time to interact with her. The only drawback was a noisy neighbor. There was a connecting door to the next room and we could hear everything the neighbors were saying.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jmoss2402
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed there 2 nights, the staff was courteous and very helpful if needed. Breakfast was great, this hotel is a must stay, we will definitely be returning as often as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff - Guests very important to Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lizlang00
Reviews.Content: When we think of our stay at the Grand Oaks Hotel in Branson, MO we think of their 'exceptional' staff members! From the front desk, assistant manager, maintenance & Donna in the 'Breakfast' area. Now this lady can 'multi-task' and with a smile for the guests. They served a 'Hot' & 'Cold' Breakfast with turn-around on keeping tables clean! And during our stay, 2 nights, they were extremely busy. Their Non-Smoking & No Pets Policy was a 'Plus' for us. We both are very allergic to animals & smoke-Their Air is Clean, Crisp & Cool. They all deserve an A+ for maintaining this Policy. Price is fair but they do have additional charges on some amendities; example- to utilize the 'Exercise' Room there is an additional charge: not much. However, their Pool & hot tubs are nice and well maintained, extra towels at front desk. Their was always someone at the front desk, so, no problems. The rooms are clean and the only concern was the small pillows. Internet was a priority for us, this was a business & pleasure trip. They do have computers available in the Lobby and for those who carry Laptops, like us, wireless is available. They were experiencing a problem but once I called, they had it all fixed and even called our room when the problem was repaired: which was a faulty part! All comes back to the Staff and how professional & courteous they are to ensure their guests enjoy their time in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: edgars4him
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night just before Christmas holiday to celebrate anniversary. We live close to Branson, so made a quick getaway. The hotel stay was included with a package for 2 day admission to Silver Dollar City, so was very economical. This was one of the best hotels we have stayed at in Branson. Hotel location was convenient. Service was excellent. Front desk staff was polite and knowledgeable. At check-in the front desk clerk even gave us a room upgrade for free when he learned it was our anniversary. Room was clean and spacious with king size bed and jacuzzi. Bed was comfortable, including the pillows. The free breakfast was not great but it was free. That day had biscuits and gravy which was adequate. The fruit selection was poor, consisting of apple sauce and canned peaches. The hostess was very nice and helpful. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “quite the bargain! clean and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: GrammyofB
Reviews.Content: We were "assigned" to this hotel from a time-share we were visiting. It was a great choice! It was clean, comfortable, and the staff were entirely accommodating. Having a hot breakfast each morning was an added plus! The heating system was even quiet (unusual at hotels). I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jamie B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights! This hotel was awesome! Everyone was very friendly! Our room was very clean, the beds were comfy, everything worked :) The breakfast area was nice & Kathi was just awesome! My kids loved her. The swimming pool and hot tub area were very nice. We stayed in the room with the sliding glass door to the pool area, the noise was not bad at all. On friday night we turned up the tv to help with the noise but would def stay in this room again. They have a computer so you can order & print your tickets from the hotel which was nice. The washer and dryer worked good. It is in a great location, right behind Ride the Ducks, Walmart, McDonalds.......I could go on forever! Def recommend this hotel to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Whatever the Hotel lacks the Staff makes up for it!”
Reviews.Author: HappyApple65
Reviews.Content: The hotel exceeded our expectations. The cost was fabulous just a little over $50.00 a night. The amenities are GREAT. The rooms are clean. Indoor Swimming pool and Hot Tub are very clean, and especially nice in the winter. They don't close the pool and spa till 11PM so even if you go to an 8:00 show you have time for a relaxing soak. The exercise room is quite nice with mirrors on one wall and lots of equipment. The staff must be paid well because they are very nice, very helpful and the breakfast is included. Not just cold stuff. They have oatmeal, waffles, eggs, sausage, lots of juices, canned fruit, toast, English muffins and even more I can't remember. The only reason I did not give them a 5 is because they do not put blankets on your bed. You use the Bedspread, I didn't like that. Close to everything just off Hwy 76.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Oaks Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dan l
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 nites. Very clean, pleasant hotel. Centrally located to major Branson attractions. Normal breakfast fare, cereal, waffles, oatmeal, some fruit (limited). Staff helpfull. No real noise issues noted. I am sensitive to noisy hotels. Pool, workout room clean. Great location. Would definately stay here again. I was relieved to have picked this hotel when driving around Branson and saw others I had been interested in. Saw six shows, only one dud, it was the Hanna-Barbour show. Don't waste your time unless you have little children with you, they may like it, overall, very amateurish production. When in Branson, many good food stops up and down the strip. For good, diner style food, head into old Branson for Branson Cafe, and Family restaurant downtown. Florintinos for italian.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Gary P
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was very nice for the price but the Wow! factor was the very nice staff Kathie and Alyson at the front desk and Alice in the breakfast area. The free continental breakfast alternated between scrambled eggs and sausage links one day, biscuit and gravy the next and Belgium waffles, oatmeal, cereal, a couple kinds of fruit, white and wheat toast, English muffins, coffee, milk, apple and orange juice every morning. WOW! This compared to the one night we stayed at another Hotel in town on the same trip that was NOT nice or clean! It's continental breakfast consisted of cereal, oatmeal, white toast, mini muffins but no milk! Oh ya down the hall they had a coffee (tasted like mud) and juice. WOW! what a difference!

Reviews.Title: “This was a very good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shellic2
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at this hotel. The staff was extremely helpful and polite. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. Location of the hotel was convienent. Had a good breakfast each morning and everything was clean. Couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Joyce M
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have pick a better place to stay.Rooms were clean and the staff were very nice and friendly.Love the spa area. The breakfast was very good.Our next trip to Branson we will definitely plan to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Lost Book”
Reviews.Author: Bob N
Reviews.Content: Upon leaving the Grand Oaks I inadvertently left a book behind. Had to call hotel 3 times to find book and then told I must use a third party sender to get it returned. A $1.90 cent bubble envelope and library rate would have been appreciated! Very poor service experience to an otherwise nice stay. Incident not handled well by Grand Oaks. Wrote them with my concerns and the Grand Oaks Hotel management never responded. Bob N

Reviews.Title: “GRAND OAKS RELIABLE QUALITY”
Reviews.Author: sonjad949
Reviews.Content: Grand Oaks has been a reliably good quality & value when we've visited Branson (3rd visit). Some reviewers have said Bldg 2 was 2nd rate, NOT SO. That bldg has NEW LUXURY beds, and newer decor, so we ASK FOR it when we go. We are handicapped and really appreciate the superior quality mattresses for a reliably good sleep. Branson can exhaust seniors! Location is very convenient being on the back road to Andy Williams theatre. The complimentary breakfast is excellent and in a beautiful area with glassed view for those in Bldg 2 (nicer, newer I think than the area for Bldg 1). Don't be afraid of Bldg 2!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location & amenities; terrible beds”
Reviews.Author: lchilds72
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have picked a better location, & several little "extras" like extra pillows and blankets in the room. However, this was all offset by the WAY too firm (hard) and uncomfortable beds. We had 4 rooms, & all were the same, regarding the beds. Pool area was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: jagboston
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located off the strip (in fact, you can get to the Andy Williams Moon River Theatre and Grille without even going back up to the strip). The staff is friendly and the room was pleasant. Coffee maker and hair dryer in room. A nice complimentary breakfast is served in an area that is near the reception desk and overlooks the indoor pool. The hotel was recommended to us by the Branson Tourism Center and we are glad we took their advice. It was so easy to get from this hotel to anywhere in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “A returning Guest who had problems and the management Corrected problem”
Reviews.Author: MotelRipsofcustomer
Reviews.Content: I am a returning guest at this motel. I had some problems when we stayed before (review: be careful when using this motel..). However, after contacting the management they where not only willing to correct the problem but we where given a complementary 2 nite stay! We chose this motel to stay at durning our anniversary! The motel was very clean! The morning breakfast staff are very nice and considerate. The staff had our reservations ready when we arrived for our stay! Im glad we gave it another go around... it really changed my mind about the place! We will be back to stay at this motel in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Stay”
Reviews.Author: Laura S
Reviews.Content: Very good clean hotel. Friendly staff. No smoking facility. Price is very good. Has stayed here many times and will stay here again. Hotel is just off the strip, which makes it easier to get around and to shows and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Saved our 35th”
Reviews.Author: Randy M
Reviews.Content: After having an absolutely horrible experience at the Welk Resort (the hotel we had reservations at for our 35th wedding anniversary), the Grand Oaks came to our rescue and made our 35th wedding anniversay one to remember. The Oaks staff from management to housekeeping went out of their way to see that every need my wife and I had was met. Thanks Grand Oaks! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Motel”
Reviews.Author: readytogoOklahoma
Reviews.Content: We purchased a package deal from Branson Tourist Center which included deluxe seating for the Andy Williams/Ann Margret Concert. The lodging which was listed in the package deal was booked for the night of our arrival in Branson so we were given accommodations at the Grand Oaks Motel as a substitute. We were assured the accommodations were comparable to the hotel which was already full. I essentially found two items lacking, but both of the items are important to me. The first was the pillow situation. We found the pillows to be of inferior quality and well-used. The second issue was the fact that the motel dining room did not serve cream, (other than in the paper packets), to go with coffee. I do expect more than packaged dried creamer to go with my morning coffee. Thus I would never stay at the Fair Oaks again, and I do not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T DO IT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: texasgw24
Reviews.Content: We went to Branson courtesy of a timeshare presentation. First of all we got checked in and was told that we had to go to building #2. Strike one. We went into building #2 and a stale smell hit you as you walk into the door. Strike two. The room is so outdated that it is not even funny. That was strike three. Three strikes your out and we will never stay here again. But it was so many things wrong that I must go on.The smell in the room was bad that my husband had to run to the store and buy an air freshner. They had a phone that had to be dated back to the 70's that square block phone. Even the clock was outdated. On the wall there was a red spot they tried to clean up but it didn't work. They also had a soap/shampoo dispenser ,mounted on the shower wall and above the sink. Now is that cheap or what? Then the room we were in was by a light that was so bright that it lit up the room. In order to block the light out of the room we had to put a blanket over the window. The gap at the door was letting in a lot of light also that we had to put a towel at the bottom of the door. Never ever again will we stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Mini Vacation”
Reviews.Author: acleve0624
Reviews.Content: We stayed over a long weekend courtesy of a Timeshare Company. For a minimal fee, it was accomodating. It was clean and quiet. The beds were a bit hard but both my boyfriend and I have back issues. The air conditioning didn't keep the room as cool as we would have liked but it wasn't a big enough problem to complain. The breakfast was a hot breakfast and Donna was wonderful and very social to everyone. Not that much parking available as they are doing construction so when that's complete, I'm sure there will be more. It was a convenient location, just off the strip, which was good. Easy access. The indoor pool and hot tub had a very strong cholorine smell. So much so that we didn't enjoy being in there for very long. There were supposed to be two hot tubs but one was closed. We did enjoy laying next to the outdoor pool in the warm sun. Nice that there were beach towels available! That was a nice touch. The showers in the bathroom were great as well. Overall, we enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, nice people”
Reviews.Author: Debhat70
Reviews.Content: Hotel is divided. Main building has indoor pool, other building has outdoor pool. They were actually two separte hotels but Grans Oaks bought the other property. We stayed in the second building. They gave us (at my request) the room closest to the outdoor pool. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was pretty standard, scrambles eggs & saugage links one day, biscuits and gravy the next. Each day they offer cereal, waffles, muffins, etc., and each building has something different for breakfast. We asked for a refrigerator and were given one with no problem. The building we stayed in had new beds, and they were very comfortable. Standard rooms, but clean and quiet. It was off of the main street (Hwy 76) just a couple of blacks and accessible by alternate raods, which turned out to be very important in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Experience I Can Remember”
Reviews.Author: Bob S
Reviews.Content: I cannot remember a stay in any hotel where I received such courteous service and help from everyone from the General Manager down to the cleaning staff. No request was unfulfilled without a smile. I never passed an employee who didn't say hello and wish me a good day. I've never felt more welcome anywhere. Hats off to a great bunch of Managers and employees!

Reviews.Title: “This place was the pits!!”
Reviews.Author: Jeff-Consumer
Reviews.Content: The room was very unclean. Upon our arrival there was what appeared to be throw up in our bathroom sink. We had to call housekeeping up to clean it. Then it reappeared. We then determined this was something falling from the drop out ceiling, from persons above us walking. Gross! Secondly we had a jacuzzi room, and the controls on the jacuzzi did not work. You could not adjust the pressures coming out of them. The pillows, bedding and comforter smelled like someones body odor. I could clearly tell that the comforter had not been changed or washed for a very long time. The pillows through the pillow cases stunk like sweat and were very flat. The king sized bed felt like I was sleeping on a piece of 4x8 plywood. The bathrooms had no towel racks to hold your towels not by the tub, nor by the sink. The shower itself had no place to hold soap, shampoo, rag etc. ! This hotel did not even offer complimentary shampoo, lotion and all that we are accustomed too. They had hair shampoo/body soap out of a pump dispenser! The carpetting was stained. The TV's were like antiques with a horrible picture. You can hear all the road noise in your room as if your windows were opened. The hottubs in the indoor pool area, had no handles to grab onto, so getting in and out of there was more than next to impossible. The chlorine level in the pools was phenomenal. You opened your eyes for a second under water outdoor pool, and your eyes began to burn something fierce! You did not even need to go into the water for the indoor pool, for your eyes to burn. You could not sit in that area because the chlorine fumes felt toxic. Lacking seating areas in the rooms as well. Plus you could not even open the windows in the room, to let out some of the stale smell in there. This continental breakfast was a joke. Hardly anything to choose from. The worst of cereals and such. The morning attendant for breakfast is a very rude individual and not nice at all. Talk about being solicited for tips......you have a sign in the room asking you to tip the housekeeping staff, something you may not mind if they did their jobs. Then at the breakfast area, to my surprise, she had a tip jar at the counter. For what? You have to serve yourself!!! The only good thing about this place I can say is the location was ok. But not even that great, because I got a ticket from the Branson PD, for using the center turn lane to turn onto Green Mountain Road. I thought turn lanes were made for turning, but not in Branson. This cost me 90.00 dollars. My family also stayed there too. My parents shower did not drain. My brothers toilet did not drain after he flushed. On the first day, my bathroom sink did not drain after I was done shaving. No one offers to help you with your bags and there is only one elevator, which was slow to say the least. At breakfast they did not even have real creamer for your coffee!! Powdered Creamer!! Come on!! No donuts at breakfast either. Plus the front desk attendant kept making comments in reference to my hair cut which quite frankly I got sick of hearing about!! For $100.00 bucks a night.......I might recommend the Hilton in Downtown or The Radissson up the street. I went through a reservation place who's reviews were misleading to say the least. Never again to Branson! And if I did, I would never, ever, stay at this dump again!!! Try spending some of that money on your over inflated rates on room upgrades and comfort instead of pocketing all of it.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: janice s
Reviews.Content: Stayed in building one, carpet was very dirty and needed to be replaced, or at best cleaned. Curtains were unkempt and had many pin holes in them, please replace them. Pillows were flat, tub was new, the pool was in much need of repair, and had so much clorine in it that your eyes began to burn and water. Hot tub had no rails to help to get in and out. Way to many tip jars and cards in room asking for tips. Breakfast was okay, personal very plesant, price was right. Would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Marlinchick
Reviews.Content: Friendly service, rooms are great! Wish they had vent fans in the bathrooms but over all great price and great place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dachshundmama
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Oaks during the first week of August. The front desk staff was pleasant and accommodating when we requested to stay in the main hotel instead of the second building that had been booked by Branson Vacation Co. Although she did point out that the beds in building 2 were more comfortable, we decided that being closer to the indoor pool was worth it. The beds were fairly comfortable and the room was clean. Breakfast was served by a very pleasant woman who chatted with guests. The food offered was average, but still more than most hotels offer. Both pools were very nice although the pool in the main building can be very noisy if you have a room close to it. Overall, a good experience at the Grand Oaks. A good value for Branson as it is close to Wal-Mart, a grocery store, McDonalds, Tanger Outlets, GoCarts, and much more. I would recommend Grand Oaks to families more interested in spending money on Branson activities rather than a high priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful when using this motel!”
Reviews.Author: MotelRipsofcustomer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this motel for the 1st time in July 2011! We put up a credit card when we made the reservations. When we arrived at the motel we then paid cash. In August 2011, 3 weeks after we checked out the card that we had used was charged for the room that we paid cash for. After contacting the manager they inform us that we could send the reciept by fax to them and they would credit the account. Their records showed there was no cash paid upon our arrival! This is POOR business! And we will not be staying here in the future! They should get front desk help that won't rip off the customers!

Reviews.Title: “nothing special”
Reviews.Author: 479bear
Reviews.Content: From the web site and name you would think this is a first class hotel but you might as well stay at the Comfort Inn. This is a typical three story hotel with one very slow elevator, no bell service and a complimentary breakfast off the lobby. It has a nice sized indoor pool but it had so much algea growing in it that my wife who is an avid swimmer would not get in it. Our room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. Over all, nothing special!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Cjordon
Reviews.Content: We go to Branson often and this was our first stay here. We will come back. Indoor/outdoor pool was nice. Breakfast was better than most and our room was clean. My only complaint is there needs to be a better ventilation system in the bathroom. After a shower everything is damp which makes it difficult to get ready. Otherwise great!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: lsimmo21
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel three times so far and it is the best value for your money. It is clean and quaint--which is the best to expect when visiting Branson... Unfortunately, I only visit Branson when we can't afford to 'fly' anywhere for the summer. So, we call it our "staycation". It is only a 3 hour road trip from the house, and it only took 1 tank of gas to get there and drive around, and 1 tank of gas for the return home. We enjoyed a 4 day/3 night vacation for a family of 5 for less than $900!! Anyway, Grand Oaks Hotel is close to all the attractions, WalMart and McDonalds are next door, and the GoKarts/Bumper Boats/MiniGolf are within walking distance. The service was great and all the attendants were friendly and welcoming. We didn't experience any problems while there. Our room was ready when we arrived and it was spotless! I guess all I care about is cleanliness, and trust me, this place wins top honors! The only flaw with this property was the continental breakfast. It wasn't good at all! But Grand Oaks is still my first choice for Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: ilreb
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in building two. I have a bad back. Mattress was soft on top but firm underneath. Best I have slept on in Branson in awhile. Very clean, nice pools, pleasant staff. Definitely would stay again. If you need to stay right next to the indoor pool, stay in building one. If you can walk for forty seconds, building two is fine. Building two was a different motel before, so it is next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: blue_eyes_rc
Reviews.Content: Front desk was very nice and helpful. They display the names of the couples that are celebrating an anniversary which I thought was really cool. It was nice to walk in each day and see our name in the lobby. The room was quiet, spacious and well laid out. We stayed in the King jacuzzi room and the jacuzzi was pure bliss. I went down at one time and got in the hot tub by the pool but didn't stay long since the jacuzzi was so much better. The complimentary breakfast left a lot to be desired and we only ate it the first morning, after that we went out (I don't recommend Shoney's either), they served a different menu in each building and it would have been nice if they would have had a menu board up showing what was being served in the other building so you could decide between the two, or better yet, serve the same thing in both. The bed was really comfortable and NO bed bugs were found there. (Some friends had warned us to check this as they had to go to three different hotels the weekend before in order to find one that didn't have bedbugs) Over all it was a very enjoyable stay.....the elevator was slower than taking the stairs and there was a funky smell in it too but I would definitely stay there again. Also the location is fabulous, it is on a side loop street from the main road so you have an alternate way to get around the traffic. The indoor swimming pool was a little colder than I would have thought it should be.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: hashj08
Reviews.Content: The hotel offered us a discount if we stayed 3 or 4 nights. We decided to stay 4 nights and received a 30% discount. They had a nice inside pool with 2 hot tubs and an outside pool, as well as a workout center. The only bad thing about the workout center was the age had to be 17 to even enter. My 13 year old was not allowed even with me. They had a room with 2 washer/dryers that I did use. Only $1 per load. I had my own lap top but needed to print and used their computer/printer to do so. But, the service was friendly and quick, nice large clean rooms, good full breakfast. Well worth the price. Normal price about $89/night. With out discount $62.99/night. A great value for the amenities offered!

Reviews.Title: “Good value... Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Scottnej
Reviews.Content: Can't really complain about anything... We were happy. Great breakfast! Bob (the breakfast man) is a joy!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing grand.”
Reviews.Author: TexasAngel63
Reviews.Content: Nothing really grand about Grand Oaks. We were given a king room in a building completely separate from the front desk building. However, there was a pool and breakfast was served in our building. So we never really needed to go the the "main" building. The man that checked us in was very nice and very helpful. The room was average to below average. There was mildew growing on the walls in the bathroom. The soap and shampoo was attached on the wall of the shower/tub. The tub was a jacuzzi tub so it was nice to use that after sightseeing in Branson all day. The first day housekeeping didn't empty our ice bucket but the bed was made. Day two and three they did a better job. The a/c worked okay once we figured out how to keep the curtain from blocking the air flow. There was a light shining into our window all night. The curtains were not very good at blocking light. The beds were fairly comfortable however the pillows were AWFUL unless of course you like torn foam stuffed into a piece of material. The furniture is worn and in need of replacement. Since we didn't spend a whole lot of time in our room it wasn't horrible. But if we ever go back to Branson we will probably try to stay somewhere else. We only stayed here because it was part of a package we got at the Branson Tourism Center. Oh! They do have breakfast from 6:30 - 9:30 a.m.. We never made it to breakfast because we slept in but there are LOTS of places to eat fairly cheap!!

Reviews.Title: “My new Branson home”
Reviews.Author: gintator
Reviews.Content: I don't live far from Branson but it was late so I decided to stay down there. I went to a few other places first they were either too high priced or did not really feel safe but I finally found the Grand Oaks and kathy was wonderful! she told me about their eclub I signed up right there at the desk and I got the 20% dicount. I loved the decor and the breakfast was great I really liked that they had a rotating hot item. I went with a girl friend so it was very nice to have the 2 vanities in the room I hate sharing a sink with anyone Ineed my space! I love the people at the front desk they said hi to me everytime I came in the doors. And when I woke up at 4 in the morning I had a great front desk girl to talk with while I drank my coffee. I don't think I can come up with a single bad thing to say. Thank you! I really love this place so it will now be my new home in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “I CAN CALL THE GRAND OAKS HOTEL A FRIEND FOR LIFE”
Reviews.Author: hi-itsmesherry--
Reviews.Content: THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU!! What a great time we had... The staff was so very pleasant, even just passing in the halls, and Alyssa at the front desk sure does know her job and does it well !! She was so very helpful with suggestions of shows and directions, even gave number to hotel to call if we got lost. She as out "ON STAR" service for the Best and First time in Branson. Breakfast was filling and satisfying, room clean and comfortable, and was SO HAPPY TO SEE EXTRA PILLOWS IN DRAWER!!! ( hotel pillow usually need more filling ) SO A BIG THANK YOU FOR THE PILLOWS!! WILL BE BACK WITH A SMILE AND HOPE TO SEE EVERYONE ON THE STAFF THERE AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful & Reasonably Priced -- Will be Back!”
Reviews.Author: MidwestOtter
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I found a great rate on AAA's website for a prepaid room (saving 20%). I booked two of them for our family, and really enjoyed the Grand Oaks Hotel. We stayed in Building 2 (outdoor pool is there) and though we walked to Building 1 to use the indoor pool, it was not a great distance away, and it worked out well. The rooms are VERY CLEAN, the housekeeping staff, the front desk staff -- all are friendly and personable and helpful. The hot water is GREAT in the shower/tubs. The beds were comfortable, the air conditioning was terrific as you can adjust your own temperature to your liking. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and it is also conveniently located just off the main drag of Hiway 76, so very convenient."

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: stl0uism0
Reviews.Content: After an exhausting drive in a storm and traffic at a crawl down the strip checking into a hotel on Memorial Day weekend was something I was not looking forward to. The check in line was long which added to my stress. Much to my surprise Brian and Bill were extremely efficient and friendly. They had the entire crowd checked in within minutes, never missing a beat. They knew which shows and restaurants were perfect for a family with tweens and had maps close at hand. They are unaware that this set the pace for the rest of our vacation. Management you have two jewels. Thanks boys! Rooms were clean and comfortable, fresh towels daily. Breakfast was great. Definitely the place to stay in Branson. I highly recommend this to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “The service was excellent with very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: zpatio6477
Reviews.Content: Our family stay at the Grand Oaks Hotel was great. The staff was friendly and helpful. A special thanks to Bill at the front desk. He was helpful in suggesting restraunts to try. The staff was great when we needed to call a cab they wasted no time in working with us.

Reviews.Title: “TOP REVIEW: As expected...”
Reviews.Author: AdaTraveler
Reviews.Content: Location: Off-strip. Behind Andy Williams. Walking distance to many restaurants, some shops, and mini golf. Service: We had a few minor issues with keys, but they were taken care of. So, I would put good service, but no one should have any issues on a trip. Rooms: Clean. Basic. Shampoo & Conditioner & Body Wash were all-in-one in soap-type dispenser Breakfast: Cereals, toast, juices, & 3 hot items each day (i.e. eggs, sausage, gravy) Staff: Wonderful. Very nice & helpful. Overall, we got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean, Comfortable, and Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Jay_Ral284
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff!. The hotel was nice, clean, comfortable, and the bed/bedding was similiar to what you'd find in a 4 star hotel. We will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: sgholli
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and really enjoyed the hotel. The price is excellent and the room choices made it easy for us to have the configuration we needed to sleep our growing family. We stayed in building 1 as it has the indoor pool. Kids loved the pool and we liked the hot tubs. The breakfast was good and saves you from having to go out to eat. The room was clean. They don't stock good shampoo or anything so you may want to bring toiletries but that is a small thing given the price and other factors that are good. It is conveniently located just off the strip near Tanger Outlet and Walmart. The only negative I had was the bed was a little hard but I am the only one who noticed, everyone else was fine. I still slept fine as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Teka71
Reviews.Content: Grand Oaks Hotel is a great place for the money. It is very clean and the staff makes you feel welcomed. The breakfast was great and felt like we were staying with your Aunt Mabel the way we were served. The room was very clean and nice arrangement. The only thing that was a negative were the flat pillows and the bed wasn't super comfortable, but sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE 4 A GREAT PRICE-A GRAND EXPERIENCE!!”
Reviews.Author: psalms_63
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Branson was a success and this hotel was the best! The location is prime and the staff was friendly and helpful. They recommended places to see and eat and they were always wanting to make our stay wonderful.The breafast was great-eggs and sausage one day,biscuits and grvy the next day..Kids loved the pool ,we loved the hot tub.the in-room coffee was great and the room was spacious with an extra sink outside of thebathroom(important for teens) Comfortable and great price!

Reviews.Title: “Old and needs updating”
Reviews.Author: 3boysandadog
Reviews.Content: Very musty dirty and outdated. Price was the only plus. I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Ok motel but there's others out there cheaper and just as nice”
Reviews.Author: I-no-lie
Reviews.Content: Good points: it is clean and it has a computer. If the motel is busy bank on having problems at breakfast time. Our pillows must have been 40 years old (flat and smelly). Rooms are small as is the bathroom but at least there are 2 sinks. Elevator is slower than molasses in January. Parking was hard. I always had to park far away (I guess we stay out too late). Older rooms but have a touch of an elegant appeal. I wouldn't stay there again but it wasn't unpleasant. Should have been priced at 45.00

Reviews.Title: “Clean place to stay in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Amber M
Reviews.Content: My family stayed over spring break. The kids loved the pool and hubby loved the 2 hot tubs, but the chlorine was so strong I couldn't stay in the pool or hot tub for more than 20-30 minutes. Rooms were clean, but on the small side. With a family of 5, we were a little squished. I was disappointed there was a desk with only one chair instead of a table in the room. No microwave or fridge, but I didn't expect to have one. Our room wasn't cleaned until after 5pm, which while was unavoidable was kinda annoying. The breakfast was great! Hot and tasty, with plenty to go around. Staff was super friendly and helpful. The only reason we might not stay here again was due to the smallish rooms. Hotel is easy to find, in a convenient location on the strip and close to Walmart, which is always a good thing when you are traveling with kids.

Reviews.Title: “HOT WATER IS A MUST....”
Reviews.Author: Paula1521
Reviews.Content: We stayed over spring break here and we had 4 rooms, two that had a door between, one next door and then one just two doors down. The over all cleanliness of the hotel was good. The pool had so much cholrine in it that you could not even sit in the pool room with out your eyes burning. The bathrooms were tiny but we did like the two sinks made it better when brushing teeth and getting ready. There was an smell in one of the rooms that we could not figure out what it was.... But the MAJOR issure was the water. I have never in my life stayed in a hotel where we did not have hot water in the mornings, my sister and husband got up at 6 am and had hot water but by 7 am when we got up no hot water NONE in the hotel. When I called the front desk all they would say is we are working on it. Same thing the next morning NO hot water. Also during the breakfast hours the lines were so long that one family got one persons breakfast fixed and the rest of them were told they were closed... what the heck! When we got ready to check out we were not able to take showers (hot ones that is) until after 9 so it made for a late check out. I told them it is hard to check out at 11 when you have no hot water..... Sorry is all they could say. I would NEVER EVER EVER stay here again! NEVER!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Value Cannot Be Beat!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alfy86
Reviews.Content: I want to start off by saying, I work in the travel industry specifically making hotel reservations. I was a little reserved about booking this room for myself and my family, however, I will be coming back to the Grand Oaks anytime I need to get away. The price was unbeatable, the beds were comfortable, the breakfast was delicious, and the pool/hot tubs were exactly what we needed after walking through SDC's Festival of Lights all day (about 35 degrees in the sunshine). Not to mention, the location was perfect as well. If you are looking to spend any amount of time in Branson and are on any kind of budget, I would strongly suggest to book at this hotel. If you're used to the Ritz, this hotel is not for you, but if you are looking to spend a night or more in a clean, safe, and affordable hotel, this one is definitely for you.

Reviews.Title: “It felt like home!”
Reviews.Author: carolann_sheppard
Reviews.Content: I have been in many hotels through out the years, and I have never been in a hotel where cleanliness was paromount in all they did. The staff was not only friendly, but they were very helpful. I would recommend this hotel to any one who will be travelling to Branson MO, the price was just right too! And one of the most convient features for me was they were right across the street from Wal-Mart!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “the best part of our trip was branson and the biggest part of it was our hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Farmington_MnDorthe
Reviews.Content: our trip was awesome. the people at the grand oaks were incredibly helpful and knowledgable. always had a smile when we were walking through the lobby. always answered our questions pleasantly. the room was great. we also thought the food at the complementary breakfast was good, too. we did notice that the surfaces of the top of the entryway and the front desk needed cleaning desperately. but that's easy enough to miss. i just happened to notice it.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: mcclars
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to this hotel. Staff was friendly and eager to please. We are used to great service in the Branson area, but this hotel's staff did an outstanding job from my initial call to reserve the room, until we left. Room was nicer than we expected. Housekeeping staff did a great job. The breakfast was well stocked, hot items were hot, and the variety of items was refreshing. I know this was off-season, but we both commented that the hotel was very quiet in spite of the number of other guests. Hotel is located right off the Hwy 76 strip....easily accessible to shows, shopping and restaurants. We would definately refer friends to this hotel.....And, we hope to return in the very near future.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: xaleyeskax
Reviews.Content: You IDIOTS writing bad reviews about this place need to get a life. What lies you tell about this place. This place is VERY clean, VERY conviently located, and a Very friendly staff. The carpets are NOT stained. The rooms are VERY clean and when I go back to Branson I WILL be staying at The Grand Oaks. OH and by the way, The bad reviews are coming from The Grand Oaks competiters NOT actual people who have stayed there. Now Stop the LIES about this place. I would ABSOLUTLY recomend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but hard beds!!”
Reviews.Author: Deana79
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a great location.The hotel was very quite and clean! The only thing we didn't like was the beds! They were hard as a rock! I would consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: lovesweekends94
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent. It is in the middle of 76. We stayed at this hotel as a package deal thru Silver Dollar City. We stayed in Building 1 on the third floor. The carpet is FILTHY!! I had my socks on and they turned brown. They use the old bed spread not comforter between two sets of sheets. Who still does that? The first night there we went and bought two new comforters to use during our stay. We had two beds in our room. The housekeeping kept providing only 2 large towels and we kept asking for more but each time we would get back to the room it would still just have the 2 towels. The beds were hard and only provided two pillows per bed. And the pillows are small. The bathrooms were clean with the plus of having two sinks so with a family of 4 like us that was great. The bathroom door barely misses the toilet. It was hard to move around that. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Stained Carpets”
Reviews.Author: imhofs
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed there on Dec 21 and Dec 22, 2010. The carpets are stained, and you feel like your walking on a dirty floor. I went to front desk and they said I could check out another room. I did and it was stained as bad. I can't belive Silver Dollar City uses this hotel as part of their package deals.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings: Good hotel, HORRIBLE beds.”
Reviews.Author: micwil25
Reviews.Content: This isnt my first time at the Grand Oaks. My fisrt time was early in the year and I was in building two. It was great. Service is wonderful and the bed was excellent. This time, however, we were in building one. Since I have back trouble, the first thing I noticed was the old-school bed. It was absolutely horrible. I called the front desk to ask about another room and they told me all the beds were the same. (I dont understand why the good beds would ONLY be in the building that was closed half the year) I had to go buy a heating pad and sleep on pillows from the spare bed in the room. I also wish the rooms had a microwave or a fridge. My only other complaint is the pool was closed for one of two days I was here. I would suggest getting additional details before staying here.... I probably wont be staying again. The money I saved on this cheaper room I am having to spend at the doctor.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: rldixon205
Reviews.Content: Grand Oaks is in a great location . They also serve a hot breakfast. The personnel are all very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “NICE PLACE TO STAY IN BRANSON”
Reviews.Author: illinoisrob
Reviews.Content: From BILL ,CHRYSTAL,ALICE and LETISHA it was good and friendly service the whole time

Reviews.Title: “Can't express enough good remarks in one sentence.”
Reviews.Author: MerluYukon_Okla_
Reviews.Content: I was with the Miley Reunion and we arrived on Wed. Nov.24. The rooms were very comfortable and the food was delicious. Thanks for allowing us to use the breakfast room for our gatherings, mornings and evenings. Alice was so good to accomodate us.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Oaks was a fantastic choice!”
Reviews.Author: onthemovemm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned home after a great trip to Branson. Our trip was made even better by our stay at the Grand Oaks Hotel. The staff was very nice, friendly, and helpful. We extended our stay by two days because we were so pleased. Our room was exceptionally clean and neat. The mattress was excellent, the pillows were the best. I have even communicated with Kathi, Assistant General Manager, and found out what kind they were, and have ordered one for myself. I have neck problems, and I did not wake up with my neck hurting while at the Grand Oaks. We would definitely stay at the Grand Oaks again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience; Great Location; Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Cheddar-1005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Oaks Hotel in Branson for three nights. The room was nice and clean, the check-in was fast and efficient; housekeeping staff were great and the continental breakfast each morning was wonderful! The person who impressed us the most was Alice, the dining room assistant! She was outstanding!! Very people-oriented! She greeted everyone with a warm smile, had a pleasant personality, talked to folks, kept the dining tables and area clean and picked up, made sure the food was always full, and even made sure I had peanut butter for my English muffins!! WOW...she is a gem!! Make sure you keep her...people like her are hard to find and she is just what people need to start their day in a positive manner!! Thanks, Alice!! We sure enjoyed seeing you every morning!! Take care and God Bless!! ---Jim and Bonnie

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel in Branson”
Reviews.Author: RoamingAimlessly
Reviews.Content: Our reservation was part of a package deal arranged by the Branson Tourism Center. (Our review was submitted for the Branson Tourism Center.) We had booked the Grand Oaks because our relatives were arriving there later in the week. The Grand Oaks was convenient to the Branson Mall, Ruby Tuesday, Wal-Mart, the Moon River Theater, the Moon River Gill, and Panera which all were close enough to walk to. The front desk said because our stay was for 6 nights the front desk arranged for us to have a first floor room, which was extremely convenient to the indoor pool, the 2 whirl pools the fitness center and the guest laundry, ice, soda and ice cream (yes, ice cream) machines were just outside the pool area. We arrived on a Monday afternoon, our reservation was accurate and the room was ready when we checked in and was adequate. This property is not fancy and is older but convenient, clean and we did not see any areas in need of major repair. We had 2 Queen beds, a nice bathroom, and a sink area out side the bathroom. There were no real issues with our room, clean and nicely decorated. The wifi was free and easy to connect but did go out for about a half hour a couple times during our stay. The complimentary breakfast was adequate to get you going, there was on alternate days, biscuits and gravy, eggs, sausage, bacon and your normal fruit, cereal, etc... The only problem we had with the breakfast was toward the latter part of the week when several bus loads of people stayed there. On those days the breakfast area was a bit crowded. On one of those days we went to the Denny's for breakfast (I'll review separately.) We did have an issue with a room next to ours when they were using a very noisy jacuzzi tub running 10 pm, we called the front desk and they were able to contact the occupants and the tub was turned off at 11:30 pm so we were able to get some sleep. We suggested to the front desk that the jacuzzi tub in the next room might need servicing as they usually don't make that much noise. The front desk was very efficient and helpful. As our reservation was part of a package we really can't speak to value; but based on the Grand Oaks website the price seems reasonable -- about $81.00/night for 2 Queen beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: jw48
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay! The room was very comfortable and clean. One of the things I look for in a hotel is a comfortable bed, and that's what I found at the Grand Oaks. I rarely sleep well when I travel, but I was able to get a good night's rest each night and didn't come home exhausted from sleepless nights. The pillows were also comfortable - not hard and flat. I also appreciated the lay-out and size of the room. The sink was outside the bathroom and had a very nice-sized counter top and mirror for getting ready each day. The furniture wasn't crammed into the room and and it was very comfortable. I also like a room with plenty of light and this room provided that. The housekeeping staff was very accommodating to my needs. I had a very pleasant stay and also felt very safe even though I was traveling alone. I look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff made me feel special”
Reviews.Author: pives32
Reviews.Content: The front desk is always great! Easy check ins and friendly service. Very knowledgable about the area and the shows!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected ...”
Reviews.Author: JAMcTravelers
Reviews.Content: The Grand Oaks is not so grand. It is in an awkward location off the strip. Our group had periods of free time, but there was nothing to do at the hotel and nothing of interest nearby that could be reached by walking; at least not an easy walk. There were few amenities in our rooms (i.e. a decent bar of soap, lotions, shampoo, shoe shine cloth, etc ...) that we find in most hotel rooms today. The advertised "hot extended continental breakfast" was not hot and offered little variety. It did not include a number of items normally offered on a breakfast buffet of this type (muffins, rolls, yogurt, a variety of fresh fruits, etc...). And we ate off styrofoam plates and drank from styrofoam cups using plactic cutlery in a small and crowded breakfast area. We did find that most of the staff was courteous, friendly and efficient, but maid service in our room was spotty. I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful return trip!”
Reviews.Author: tbuehler
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth or fifth year that we have held our family reunion at the Grand Oaks and we will no doubt be back. The rooms are clean and roomy, the complimentary breakfast with hot biscuits and gravy and a friendly hostess is the best. Because we reserved several rooms for the family, we had a complimentary hospitality room for the family to gather in and visit. The manager on duty on Friday night when we first arrived was outstanding. He went above and beyond to make sure the room was exactly what we wanted. He brought us styrofoam containers of ice and a large coffee pot with coffee and cups. The hotel is off the Strip but close enough, too. We couldn't have found anything better than the Grand Oaks!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place except for mattresses”
Reviews.Author: fshnfrek
Reviews.Content: All of the staff were extremely pleasant and helpful and made the stay quite enjoyable. The room was nice and primary complaint is that the mattresses were terrible. Felt like sleeping on springs or coils all night long. Carpet in room also showed a lot of staining and should be replaced or cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place Stay”
Reviews.Author: Russmo
Reviews.Content: Great accomodations and service. Wonderful staff. Great location. My four day stay could not have been better.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: msjackieo
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay here. The staff was nice and friendly. I feel as though it was someplace we had been before. I would stay again. There are two buildings. We stayed in the first one. The breakfast was complimentary. Nothing to write home about. However we did enjoy it and were very happy that we saved some money on food. Apparently others felt the same,as it was busy. Again staff was great. Nothing really stood out, in a bad way or a great way. It was Comfortable and staff was nice.

Reviews.Title: “staff was friendly and helpful, enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: sandydial
Reviews.Content: enjoyed our stay, staff was helpful, think a microwave in the room might be good addition

Reviews.Title: “Grand Oaks”
Reviews.Author: bdavis3300
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days at the Grand Oaks. It was a great hotel. The staff was extremely helpful for what ever you needed. I especially want to comment on the lady (Alice, I believe) that handled the breakfast. She was great. I liked everything about the hotel and would certainly stay again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel was triffice”
Reviews.Author: bclauson44
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very clean, the breakfast was very good , and had a good verity of food in it. the people was very nice and helpful. Everybody was very good to us. My 6 year old daughter like it very much also.

Reviews.Title: “Handicap Friendly”
Reviews.Author: DBH111
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at the Grand Oaks Hotel the weekend after Labor Day. We needed a handicap room with two beds -- they are not easy to find! We were pleasantly surprised to find our room very, very clean and roomy. The people who work at this hotel are very friendly, nice, and accomodating. We also liked the fact that we were off the main drag and could easily get in and out of the hotel. Yes, the hotel does not have refrigerators or microwaves in the room, but we found we didn't need them. They do let you use their microwave in the dining area. The only concern I had was the breakfast offerings -- very limited, but we made the best of it. Overall, very pleased with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place and People”
Reviews.Author: catsfan008
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very accomodating--nice pool and hot tubs--hot breakfast-- the employees are very accomodating and friendly.. The only thing I would add is small refridgerators and microwave ovens in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Poor outdoor facilities”
Reviews.Author: SaintPaul_MNDottie
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in your "overflow" building. (behind the nice one) Our room was clean and employees were friendly and kind. Being a smoker, I was very disappointed with your outdoor facilities. There are no chairs or out of the way seating area to accommodate the smokers of the world. We still do exist. The out door patio area off the breakfast room can only be used during the breakfast hours, as after that time it is locked and can not be opened with a room key. I fully understand and respect the no smoking policy for the interior of your buildings, but do not believe the smokers should have to wander around the parking lot to smoke a cigarette.

Reviews.Title: “Great Motel /Greater People”
Reviews.Author: cplbish
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I have traveled to Branson Mo many times , and we use to stay at a different motel each stay to try and find one that suited use , we stayed one weekend at Grand Oaks a few years ago and have never looked back , this is the finest motel with the greatest staff in Branson Mo bar none . We use to go only once a year , now because of the friends we have made at the Grand Oaks we try to go as many times as possible . This Motel has all your looking for , large and clean rooms, in and outside pools , and breakfast each day , and the greatest staff you will ever have . I am totally disabled and in a power chair and this is where I will always stay in Branson because the rooms are large and well equipped. Sincerely Art & Chris Bishop

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Hellokittylover32
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at Stone Castle Inn ( Do not recommend) and decided to leave so I called Grand Oaks and they were very nice told me to come in early the next morning to speak about getting a room before check in times. We got to the hotel and they were so nice she checked us in immediatly we were able to go straight to our room. We stayed in the 2nd building it was very roomy the beds were so comfy with brand new linens. The only complaint we had was the AC wasn't as cold as we would have liked but to be honest it was so hot outside when we came in we wanted it extra cool. That night I called to see if we could stay again. The desk clerk was very nice and said all the double beds were booked up. He booked us into a suite with a rollaway. So that morning I checked out of that room and into the suite. By the time we got back from sight seeing our rollaway was there and it was very comfy. We didn't get up in time to eat breakfast or swim there but it looked like everyone was enjoying themselves in the pool. I think we have found our home away from home. Excellent hotel with clean rooms and bedding. The room is a bit dated with furniture but it was all we needed. A comfy bed makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, relaxing, everything we needed”
Reviews.Author: Aaron6864
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stays at the hotel. We have stayed in other hotels in Branson but have decided that the Grand Oaks is where we will continue to stay. It is conviently located and has all the amenties we need. The folks at the desk are friendly and the manager, Mr. Lee Thomas is truly concerned about making his guest confortable. The brakefast is also a plus, because it is also included at no extra cost. This is grate when you have little ones. I strongly suggest that everyone try this hotel. Bob Miller

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, accessible to everything and w/ friendly staffs.”
Reviews.Author: pearlady49
Reviews.Content: Grand Oaks Hotel in Branson, Missouri, is a great place to stay for a getaway vacation. Staffs are friendly with smile on their face everytime. It is accessible to almost all shows, restaurants, and just a walking distance from Branson Mall and Wal-Mart. Do not forget to visit Grand Oaks Hotel folks, everytime you are in Branson, Missouri. Great, great place to stay. Thank you for being a part of our memorable and enjoyable vacation. We will see you again.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful 40th Anniversary Stay!”
Reviews.Author: GrammyRMS
