Reviews.Content: From check in to check out, the staff at the Grand Oaks Hotel was professional, friendly, and helpful. The level of customer service they provided was extraordinary! The entire facility was clean and well-kept. Our room was very spacious and comfortable. The pool and hot tub were immaculate as were all of the other common areas. And the breakfast they provided! Just like being at home! The location is ideal. Close to everything but off the "strip" enough to be quiet. Thanks Grand Oaks staff, especially Scott and Josh!

Reviews.Title: “Always so clean and staff is friendly”
Reviews.Author: srouton
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Grand Oaks for years and is always our first hotel choice in Branson. The hotel is always so clean (the bathrooms are spotless). We also like having two sinks in the room. The location off the strip is perfect. Alice, the breakfast attendant is so friendly. We always look forward to seeing Alice. She's so pleasant, fun and helpful. Kathi, the assistant manager, is very helpful as well. Thanks for always offering a perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: sheldt
Reviews.Content: Very clean and staff was very helpful with information on shows and directions. Breakfast was tasty and attendant did a good every morning.

Reviews.Title: “this is a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: john4244
Reviews.Content: hotel is very clean & well kept. staff is very friendly & helpful. special praise to alice the breakfast room attendant who went out of her way to be more than helpful insuring that guests had what they needed and in a timely fashion. rooms were comfortable and kept clean would suggest small refrigerators be added for guest convience.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: 2Mitchells
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Grand Oaks July 16-18th; it was fantastic! After a hot day at Silver Dollar City with temps about 98 degrees; it felt great to get into our spacious air conditioned room w/jacuzzi!! Great indoor pool in building #1, also has two hot tubs; there is a outdoor pool avail. at building 2! (next door). We stayed on the fourth floor great view near 76 (the strip). Andy Williams Moon River and WalMart are a blk away. Highly recommended! A+++

Reviews.Title: “almost perfection”
Reviews.Author: dyanthony12
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean throughout. Close to everything that we did. Great service and polite staff that gets to know you well. Enjoyed our stay soooo much that we are planning to come back next year and are hoping to stay in the same hotel. The only downfall was that the pool was a little cold but it didn't seem to bother our daughter at all. We had a lot of fun.Thanks for a great first family vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Rob53166
Reviews.Content: This is a nice quiet place to stay,It's in a great location.The staff are nice and helpful.It had a small breakfest selection but it was real good.This the only hotel I will stay at while in Branson,MO

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tlark47
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out the staff was very friendly, helpfull and courtesy. The rooms were very nice, clean and the beds were very comfortable. The hotel is located just off the strip on and access road which makes getting around a lot easier. The feel breakfast was very good with a hot item each day.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: sophie32200
Reviews.Content: Grand Oaks is a nice clean and very friendly place to stay. The lobby is a little dated but the rooms are very nice and clean and it is close to the action.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel will visit again.”
Reviews.Author: tinykhambone
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five days. Staff were wonderful and hotel was very clean. Exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great time! Would stay agian!”
Reviews.Author: Heather2780
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights with our 10 and 6 year olds, I found this hotel to be clean and comfy, the staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast was more than basic it was nice to have a hot item each day and there was no shortage of food, the staff member serving breakfast was cheerful and welcomming. Very convienent location to food and attractions! We will definitly stay there agian!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Dunnoaname
Reviews.Content: Grand Oaks Hotel more than met my expectations. When my friend and I did Priceline for the first time we were afraid that we would end up in a ghetto motel, but we didn't. It was wonderful! The room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. The housekeepers were more than helpful when we asked for anything (like when we accidentally locked ourselves out of our room- oops!) and the other hotel employees were always courteous and helpful too. My only complaint (which isn't much of one), is that cont. breakfast is only until 9:30am and I like to sleep later on vacation...don't worry, I still got up for the breakfast! :o) I would definitely stay there again and would, and have already, recommended it to friends! Added bonus, indoor AND outdoor pool (one at each of the two buildings there).

Reviews.Title: “Already booked this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: micwil25
Reviews.Content: We arrived and the front desk was very nice. Everyone was helpful and polite. The lobby did smell a bit like a nursing home to me but the rooms we all fresh and smelled great. The rooms were very nice and the beds were great. Breakfast was basic but ok. We will stay again.... I have already planned another trip with this hotel. A+++

Reviews.Title: “Rude breakfast server”
Reviews.Author: redneckman24
Reviews.Content: The rooms were great the indoor pool was nice and warm good motel but the old lady serving breakfast pushed my daughter and told her to move out of the way she was very rude and I complained to the front desk about her they said it was the third complaint they had for her that day good motel bad breakfast lady

Reviews.Title: “Good central location in Branson.”
Reviews.Author: Bateach3
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to the theater strip. Good free breakfast daily.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBfly
Reviews.Content: After I booked our room through Hotwire I saw some of the negative reviews and was concerned; however, when we arrived I was pleasantly surprised. We were put in building #2, but the only disadvantage that I could see was not being in the same building as the indoor pool and the courtesy computer. Our room was clean with comfy beds and pillows. If I had to find something to complain about it would be that our curtains were just a little too short for the window. Overall we had a GREAT experience especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place in Heart of Branson”
Reviews.Author: oldertraveler68
Reviews.Content: We were a large group staying for several days. We were in Building 1. The rooms were clean, the location the best. We were not too far from the alternate routes for faster access to shows, shopping and good eating. We were an older group so the elevator was a real plus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but room for improvement.”
Reviews.Author: BIRDWHISLER
Reviews.Content: I received an e-mail about special rates, so decided to book a room. We have stayed at this hotel for many years. Even at the special rate, I believe the rooms are still a bit over-priced. I belong to their e-club, so I felt that surely was the best rate available, but am not sure that to be the case. Anyway, we were supposed to get a coupon book upon arrival, didn't get it. Had to ask for it on the second day. The staff has never been overly-friendly. The toilet in our room over-flowed, we were given another room, and the sink backed up in it. I told the desk upon check-out, didn't get an apology or an offer to take anything off the bill. Both rooms had an odor to them. With that said, that is why I feel that there is room for improvement. I do love their pool, they could use new hot tubs, the jets aren't that strong. They could use a good cleaning, also. I was booked in building 2 one time, and didn't like it at all. We got ou money back and left. Grand Oaks, with a little improvement and rate reduction, you would be rate an A. One more thing, they now charge to use the fitness room--not good!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel close to attractions”
Reviews.Author: huskertravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Grand Oaks the end of June. Arriving a little late the clerk said she could not accommodate our reservation and we would have to pay extra for the main building. Since we were tired I did not argue.The room was clean and modern, pool looked nice, but had a few problems they fixed the next day while we were out.. (main light not working and toilet running.) The location works out well for getting around to the attractions. The price was ok but other hotels looked just as nice or better for the price. I called back when I got home and the reservationist cheerfully refunded the extra money we had to pay when I gave her my confirmation number.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was clean. The staff were very courteous.”
Reviews.Author: bhasler
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed seeing the Butterfly Palace, Noah. Only sour note of whole trip was dealing with the Ghost and Haunted Tour people. I had not gotten a pamphlet from them only a phone number. I called to get a reservation. I was only intending to go myself but the young man on the phone told me that I should go ahead and reserve space for the other 3 people and that if they didn't show I would not be charged. Other people in the hotel room heard the conversation. When I arrived at the office for the tour I was told that was not the case but when I explained that to the office manager he told me that he would handle the situation and that "they would do what he told them to do." And of course I had a $60.00 charge on my account when I got home. I called about it and the office manager told me that he had reviewed the case and that the "young woman" I talked to (and he provided a name) had told me that I would be charged. When I explained that I had in fact not spoken to a "young woman" but had spoken to a young man...he said he needed to check into the matter. Interesting...he had started the conservation of telling me he had already "checked into the matter" When he called me back of course it was the same thing that I hadn't been told that at all. He stated that their policy was that if two people had a reseveration and only one showed up they would only be charged for one. But if 3 people had a reseveration and only one showed up they would be charged for the two that didn't show. I managed to get a flyer from someone who had also visited Branson. I looked at the bottom of the flyer and it said all people would be charged if they did not show up for their reservations. That makes sense to me but I did not have the flyer at the time and could only go on what was told me over the phone. If you follow the thread there are actually 3 different stories on how this company charges people for missed reservations. In their response to the Better Business Bureau the company is asserting that I am a wicked person who is trying to get money from an honest company but in the next sentence they said I just didn't understand what I had been told. So they are saying a wicked, evil, and stupid person. I will admit that the young lady who gave the tour understood her material very well and my time with her was enjoyable. It is with regret that I have to say that the company she works for is not an honest company as they assert and they will attack on a personal level if you speak up for your rights.

Reviews.Title: “BETTER THAN REVIEWS PORTRAY”
Reviews.Author: BERGEAUX
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited Branson for our summer vacation. We thorughly enjoyed our stay and even booked an extra two nights because of the great service. The pool is spacious and not small by any means. Breakfast was satisfying and my 6 yr old and I went down to the other building to eat one morning b/c they had the waffles there. The room was cleaned on request and I cant see where the bad reviews come from. Maybe some people are just too spoiled. Good Job Staffers from Grand Oaks. You made our trip worth another visit. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “HAIRS ON SHEETS!! Twice!!! Don't stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: TexasFloMoMom
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Priceline as a 2-star property for $40 - what I had hoped was a good deal --WRONG! My family and I checked in late at night. We entered our room in building 2 and began unpacking and getting ready for bed. Our first impressions weren't great, but all we needed was a place to sleep. When I pulled the sheets back, I discovered hair -- gross! Not wanting to make a big deal in front of the kids, my husband called the front desk and told them he was coming for two new sets of sheets. When he returned, we began making the bed again and found MORE HAIR IN THE "CLEAN" SHEETS! Totally unacceptable. No way would we would allow our family to sleep in these nasty conditions, so we packed up and headed out. My husband stopped at the front desk to tell them them we would not be staying and the front desk was unapologetic and unwilling to process any kind of a refund. They told us we needed to take our issue up with Priceline. We headed north out of Branson and I was on the phone with Priceline for nearly two hours. (between 11:30 pm and 1:30 am!!!) They could not or would not guarantee any kind of refund and told us we would have to wait until the morning when they could request the refund from the hotel manager - but they wouldn't promise any money back. In the meantime, all they would offer to do for us is to locate another hotel at a much higher rate -- no way. Thank goodness for our GPS. We eventually found a great Residence Inn in Joplin. If you don't mind sleeping in someone else's sheets - then the Grand Oaks is the place for you. If not -- find another location!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the money- Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: FordGurl
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel thru Priceline. We ended up paying a total of $110 for 3 nights including tax! Our room was decent- a king bed, sleeper sofa, 2 person jacuzzi tub, refrigerator, microwave - Large room. My 9 year old complained the sleeper sofa was uncomfortable. Our bed was ok- nothing to brag about. The hotel offers a VERY basic continental breakfast- coffee, donuts, bread, biscuits and gravy, milk, Cheerios, Raisin Bran. On a good note- there are several restaurants offering full breakfast selections for a reasonable price within walking distance. There are several attractions within walking distance. There is a decent laundry room in each building. The only drawback was the indoor pool. There was so much chlorine I could smell it upon walking in the front door. We spoke with a teenager who actually got very sick from the chlorine. He vomitted and went to bed for several hours before feeling better. He was only at the pool for a short time. Needless to say we did not try the indoor pool. The outdoor pool was ok. Nothing fancy but enjoyable for the 9 year old. Oh- the elevator in building 2 (where we stayed) was very slow. We usually took the stairs. Overall I would say this hotel is just fine. Not the Radisson by no means but a decent place for a decent price! We would stay there again even if we could not get the great deal we got thru Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “good value for what I paid”
Reviews.Author: Stealhunter
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Expedia for 54.00 a night and I got clean room, a very good continental breakfast, an indoor pool for the kids which was nice because it rained. The location is just off the strip, I used the backroads to get around Branson. Beds weren't the best, but once again, I got the room for 54.00.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay ever again”
Reviews.Author: gkis27
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter and her three children to the hotel. We were put as far away from everyone as possible. That didn't bother me, but the mattresses on the beds were awful! The hideaway sofa/bed mattress was more comfortable than the regular bed. There were little to none amenities in the bathroom. There was so much chlorine in the swimming pool that when you walked in the door your eyes started to burn. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An OK place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: jah1982
Reviews.Content: It's not the worse place you can stay in Branson, but it surely isn't one of the best. If it wasn't for the "great deal" with a 90+ minute try to buy a resort we would have stayed in a better hotel. Building 1 is where you check but then you are sent to building 2 for your room. Free breakfast? yeah it was free but not that great. Rooms were clean and the beds sure did have alot of bounce in them! No WiFi in building 2

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong!”
Reviews.Author: cfarmerbrown2
Reviews.Content: Wow, this was an awesome place. We booked this hotel through the Branson Visitors Bureau along with some shows. It was awesome. Anything you needed was either at the hotel, or just around the corner. Exceptionally clean, well stocked with toiletries. Indoor pool was awesome and the hot tubs were great! Staff was subperb. I would definately recommend and would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Ooverpriced, Old Rooms In Bldg 2, No Wireless, No Fan In Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: KDBMidsouth
Reviews.Content: I made the mistake of reserving by phone. They told me $80.99 + tax per night. I booked it about a month in advance and didn't think anything more about it. When we got there they charged us $103.00 + tax! Of course they didn't send a written confermation, so I had no proof. Building 2 is horrible.....very old rooms, no wireless internet access, no bathroom fan and your free breakfast wasn't much to write home about. The pictures on the internet make it look alot nicer that it is, believe me. For $116.00 (total) we could have stayed in a brand new hotel!

Reviews.Title: “No problems here”
Reviews.Author: Shirleyrajala
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel and all 10 of our shows through an agency and had a very good experience over all. The staff at the Grand Oaks was especially pleasant, from the front desk through the breakfast hostess, housekeeping, everyone was exceptionally pleasant and helpful. The room was immaculate and comfortable, not far from the pool on the bottom floor of building one, the chlorine odor was a little strong but didn't permeate into the rooms. The extended complimentary breakfast was wonderful, but crowded because of four busloads of guests gathering there at the same time. Even then the hostess was patient and efficient. The location was central, but off the strip away from the heavy traffic Branson is known for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JCFIA
Reviews.Content: Our one night stay was booked at this hotel by our Timeshare Co. who somehow lost our reservation when we arrived in the middle of the night. We were exhausted & just wanted to go to bed. The desk clerk was very nice & acted quickly to get us into our room. The room was clean & pleasant and the bed was comfortable. The pillows were a little flat though & the bathrooms need a fan/vent. The breakfast was very good. The staff were all very pleasant and the attendants at breakfast were very hospital. A late departure was also arranged for us so we has some time to relax before checking into our timeshare. That gave us some time to look around the hotel. The only negative was that the indoor pool had too much chlorine & we couldn't even stand inside the door without our eyes burning. Overall if we had to find a place to stay in Branson again - I would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “It wasn't bad”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Travel19
Reviews.Content: It was okay, I mean if you're used to nicer it's an adjustment, but at least it's clean. The entire building smelled like chlorine, so be prepared. Must be because the indoor pool. It's bare minimum and somewhere to stay if you plan to not be in the hotel a lot. We slept fine....well...until the mornings when you could hear the kids in the room next to us...so yes, paper thin walls, but theirs thruth in the fact that you get what you pay for. It's right by Wal-Mart, Panera and McDonals, too. So, I think this hotel is average...no real problems...just average because it's nothing special when you're used to higher rated hotels. I'd probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Smoky but Accessible”
Reviews.Author: traveling4StLouiis
Reviews.Content: My family and I received 2 free nights at Grand Oaks. It was conveniently located - mini golf, Panera, Walmart, and several other eateries. They also serve breakfast in which they alternate between bldg 1 & 2 on continental and a hot buffet - not bad though. My children LOVED the outdoor pool, there was another one in bldg 1. My only complaint is that it smelled like smoke. With my son's asthma this was a problem. Needless to say we only stayed 1 night. I'm glad I didn't have to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Stay”
Reviews.Author: wkburch
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled to Branson for a family vacation. I looked at several options for lodging and this one SEEMED great, deluxe rooms, indoor and outdoor pool, great location etc. The front desk people were nice even gave us an option of what floor we wanted to stay on. But that is about as good as it got. The beds were HORRIBLE! The hardest and loudest bed I have ever slept on. It sounded like it was filled with plastice wrap. Every time my husband or chirldren turned over it woke the rest of us up. The walls are also very thin. I heard the people next door coughing all night and going to the bathroom. The bathroom was very small. The door barely missed the toilet when you opened it. The indoor pool was small and had a very strong chlorine odor. The hot tubs were small and not jetted, and dirty. The breakfast wasn't too bad. We checked out after one night and went to a local condo. The rest of our stay in Branson was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: Traylor1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here through a time share tour. We were nervous, but EXTREMELY satisfied in the end. Very clean, very friendly, good breakfast(for a free breakfast). Minuses were beds were too firm for me. Pillows were very thin and the indoor pool was cold. However, compared to other Branson area hotels, this was one of the best we have stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay....Will Come Again”
Reviews.Author: headed2thebeach
Reviews.Content: Just returned from grand oaks hotel today....we stayed in bldg 1..room with 2 queens...a normal room...clean...had all the things we needed,,however,,there was no fan in the bathroom which was wierd so when ya take a shower it gets real hot ,,then ya have to wait a while to put your face on and do hair for the mirror to dry,,but oh well....the hot breakfast was ok..standard...biscuits n gravy,,,french tst,,,waffles...oatmeal....I have stayed alot nicer..but for the price and location..it was great,,,its right off the strip so its not so crazy...and ya got a walmart and a grocery store right by ya,,and a mcdonalds(yeaH) for the kids!!! 2 hot tubs also indoors were relaxing with plenty of lounge chairs,,,2 pools also one in and one out....we had a nice stay....fitnes center...and laundry also onsite.....

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a red headed stepchild!!”
Reviews.Author: ArkansasSleepyhead
Reviews.Content: We booked our rooms thru the Branson Tourism Center and I think that was our first mistake....more about that later. This hotel is just OK. It is actually two buildings, the one in the front has the "deluxe" rooms. The building around back, or building two, is where we stayed. We felt like red headed stepchildren after comparing the other building with ours. All in all the rooms were very small and shabby looking. The continental breakfast was biscuits and gravy (not good tasting) and canned fruit and stale donuts. I just was not impressed at all. Now back to the Branson Tourism Center, Do NOT repeat NOT book any packages and rooms thru them. When you go to pick up your tickets they put a lot of pressure on you to do one of those tour a vacation resort things. They tried to get us to go for a two hour presentation of the Wyndham Resorts or something like that. Even after telling them no, they kept on and on.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: BIGMIKE74133
Reviews.Content: Booked a weekend trip to Branson and stayed at the Grand Oaks for a 2nd time. The 2nd time around was just as enjoyable as my 1st time staying there. Very clean room, Great friendly staff that greets your when you enter and leave there hotel. Speedy check in and check out. Above average breakfast. The Hotel has two buildings. Building one has the inside pool and building 2 has the outside pool. When I checked in I was booked in Building 2. when I went to the room it was large and very nice but I wanted to be in the building with the inside heated pool since it was cold that weekend. So after calling the front desk I was told to come back to the front and she would move me to building 1 without a problem. By the time I drove back to the front desk (which was less then 5 minutes) the desk lady had my new room key ready and we exchanged keys and I was on my way to my new room in building one. Great service!!! The hotel is tops on my list when I visit Brason because of the great location,price and very friendly staff that makes your visit so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “It Was Grand!”
Reviews.Author: ChloeMom
Reviews.Content: We arrived a couple of hours early and asked if we could check in. We had to wait an hour for our room but that was our fault., after all we were early. They were very accomodating getting us in before check in. Also was not a frig in our room (even though I asked for one when I made the reservation). They brought one in and set it up for us. The room was wonderful. We had a jacuzzi suite. We have stayed at quite a few Marriots and Hiltons and this was just as nice. If there was one thing that disappointed us, it was the complimentary breakfast. Not only was the only hot thing oatmeal (which I hate), what they did have was not good. The doughnuts were stale and the fruit was canned. When I mentioned at check out that we didn't like the breakfast, the manager said we should have went to the other building because they had bisquits and gravy. I told him no one told us that and if they would have, we would have went over there. They need to tell people what building is serving what hot breakfast item. Other than the breakfast, it was great and well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Beds, Front Doors do not open automatically, Small Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Cami40
Reviews.Content: "They don't have doors that open by themselves!" was the first thing I said to my kids as we walked in. One elevator. Small room, barely any room for the futon that we paid $10 extra for. Beds were very hard! Although I like a hard bed, the rest of my family does not. The hotel did not look at all like the pictures on their website. The gal at the front desk said that the deluxe rooms were only called deluxe because they needed to differentiate between the rooms in the two buildings. We didn't see the other building, but our building and room were in no way deluxe.

Reviews.Title: “No problems at all”
Reviews.Author: monbow
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Grand Oaks. We were offered a room with 2 queen beds in Bldg 1, a king sized bed in Bldg 2 or upgrade to a jacuzzi suite for $30/night extra. After reading some of the reviews from those that stayed in Bldg 2, I was a little nervous but we went with the king room. The front desk advised all of Bldg 2 is non-smoking and I didn't smell a hint of smoke anywhere. They have signs in the rooms that say if you do smoke, they will bill you an extra $250 to sanitize the room when you leave. I think that's a good deterrent!! The bed was comfortable. The only issue we had was that they hide the blanket - it's not on the bed, it's in the drawer?!?!? Although we did not upgrade to the jacuzzi suite, we still had a jetted bathtub. If you want to go swimming, it is an uphill hike to Bldg 1, so we drove instead. The breakfast was decent and served in both buildings. Very close to Wal-Mart, grocery & Panera Bread. Overall, very pleased and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Henry Family Reunion”
Reviews.Author: travelersLincolnMO
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location just off the Hwy 76 strip in Branson, MO. It's a great facility and the staff was most accomodating. We found it to be such a great place for our family reunion we plan to use it again. The conference room in building two worked great for us. We had a meeting place where we could play games, work on a jigsaw puzzle and hold an auction. The breakfast is more than donuts and coffee and has something for every member of the family. Staying there was truly an enjoyable experience. Great Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Packy72
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying in the Grand Oaks Hotel during our last visit in September 2007. The location was great, the rooms were so very nice and clean. The staff of the hotel were cordial, friendly, and very helpful. We enjoyed the continental breakfast, hot and offered all the goodies you would want. We would choose to stay at the Grand Oaks Hotel anytime we are in Branson, Mo. We would suggest anyone to stay there. Thanks for making our vacation so enjoyable. Alvis & Reba Harry

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: ousoonergirl1
Reviews.Content: My family of (8) stayed at the Grand Oaks Hotel in May 2007. We had two rooms in Building #2. Upon arrival there were already other guests making complaints at the front desk because of overbooking. It should have been a good indication to us to leave. When we made the reservations we requested Non-smoking rooms because of asthma related issues. One room was fine but the other room reeked of smoke. We called the front desk and they moved us to another room. The rooms were average, dirty carpet and uncomfortable beds. The continental breakfast is pretty standard with the other hotels in Branson. Because there are two separate building, there is quite a walk to go to the indoor pool in Building #1 (all up hill). The biggest problem we had was the elevator kept breaking down. With only one elevator in the building it made it very difficult especially since we were on the 3rd floor. We asked if they could accomodate other arrangement for my father because he was disabled and unable to climb stair. They informed us that the elevator breaking was beyond their control. Therefore, my father had to spend one whole day in the room because he was unable to climb the stairs. I thought the managment could have been a little more understanding. Branson is full of hotels, I suggest you try somewhere other than here. If you decide to stay request Building #1 and don't settle for anything less!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: godsgift03
Reviews.Content: The staff are amazing!!! They were so friendly and so helpful. My fiance and I are from the south but now live in KC. We truly felt like we were at home when we walked into the hotel. We had a jacuzzi king suite and it was remarkable. The cleaning crew was very friendly and very accomodating. We will be back and will ONLY stay at this hotel. We recommend it to all of our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: hawley1
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying August 10-17th in Branson, MO. This was our third time there, second time there with our son who is now 6-1/2 years old. We had a super time as we always do in Branson. The hotel was very clean and the employees were very friendly as well. Our room was always very clean and if we ran out of anything we could always request more of something from the front desk. We loved both the indoor and the outdoor pool but the outdoor pool is down a hill so we would just drive our vehicle down there as it was just easier, especially with how hot it was the week we were there....113 the highest that week. Ouch! The free breakfast was very good. They had cereal, biscuits and gravy, french toast, bananas, oatmeal, coffee, juice.....perfect for us as we don't like to eat big breakfasts in the morning. Previously we had stayed at Mountain Music Inn and Southeran Oaks but we preferred the Grand Oaks over the other two places. We liked the location of Grand Oaks and also the cleanliness. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Oaks; Grand Time”
Reviews.Author: myvacationgreenwood
Reviews.Content: You won't find a nicer hotel, centrally located in the heart of Branson, that guarantees a great price, clean rooms, indoor pool and an excellent staff who will meet all of your needs. We have stayed there for many years and have never been disappointed. If you are looking for a wonderful vacation or simply a weekend getaway, stay at the Grand Oaks. Greenwood AR

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KCGuy5
Reviews.Content: For our only vacation of the year I took the family to Branson, Mo. We stayed at The Grand Oaks Hotel which is in the middle of everything and only one block from the strip. Upon arriving at the hotel one of the first things I noticed was how clean it was. Seeing the room was no different. Everything was spotless and the oversized bath towels made this hotel a cut above. We stayed in the Pinnacle Suite and I'm not sure if the kids liked the in-room jacuzzi or the indoor pool better. What a hit. The continental breakfast was good - nothing fancy - but certainly enough to get you going. And they always had hot coffee through out the day. Overall, this hotel was more than I bargained for. Clean, great location, decent room rate and as is the case most everywhere in Branson, very friendly folks!

Reviews.Title: “Family Reunion at Grand Oaks”
Reviews.Author: Spkr62
Reviews.Content: We have just completed a wonderful weekend at Grand Oaks Hotel, Branson, MO for a family reunion. The accomodations were excellent with no complaints; in fact, our entire group voted to come back in two years and to go ahead and book since the facilities and the personnel were so nice. We used a block of rooms, all centrally located, a wonderfully equipped Hospitality Room which was kept private for us in which we ate, visited, played games, andconducted our own church service, the outdoor pool, and the roomy dining area upstairs for the continental breakfast each morning. The rooms and the staff couldn't have been better. Lee Thomas, the general manager, was very accomodating prior to and during the stay.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE BEDS!”
Reviews.Author: regnimesi
Reviews.Content: The beds are hard and have noisy plastic covers over the matresses. The matresses are very hard and of three of us, no one slept well and I know I woke up with a very sore lower back. The room lacked a decent chair for sitting. It did have one desk chair. There was no coffee pot like most places in this price range. There is only one vending area on floor #1 of a 4 story building. The place was very clean, the staff (excpet the lady working the breakfast area) was friendly and helpful. We stayed in the main building. There is NO WAY I would return due to the beds. The comfort of a good nights sleep is #1 with me. Then cleanliness is #2. I'm glad we were only staying one night or we would have had to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: Older_Wiser
Reviews.Content: It's been a few months since we stayed a few nights along with friends from Texas. We all rate this hotel A-1. The rooms were very clean, the folks at the service desk were extremely helpful & friendly. We will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “We're coming back”
Reviews.Author: queenmum2
Reviews.Content: We were offered a trip to Branson by a Time Share Co. They booked us at this hotel and it was a wonderful experience. Our room was kept immaculately clean, any questions we had were answered, the breakfast each morning was a joy. The staff was more than courteous. We anticipate returning to Branson and will definitely stay at this hotel. It is off the main drag, so to speak, but extremely convenient to everything. Thank you so much. The Emmerts

HotelInfo.Name: Grand Oaks Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 2315 Green Mountain Dr, Branson, MO 65616
